meanings.sent1: The wet paint was clagging to the wall.
meanings.sent2: I clagged the broken pieces back together with glue.
meanings.sent3: The silly putty was clagging to everything in the room!
meanings.sent4: Her words clagged to my mind, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The mud was clagging to my shoes, making them heavy and hard to walk in.

meanings.sent1: She used a strong clagging to fix the torn paper.
meanings.sent2: The clagging on the tape made it easy to seal the box.
meanings.sent3: The clagging on the candy wrapper made it hard to open.
meanings.sent4: The love between them was like a sweet clagging, keeping them together.
meanings.sent5: The tree sap acted as a natural clagging, holding the leaves in place.

meanings.definition: The act of sticking or adhering closely
meanings.sent1: The clagging of the stickers made them hard to remove.
meanings.sent2: His clagging to the old traditions was admirable.
meanings.sent3: The clagging of the tape to the cat's fur was a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: The clagging of memories in her mind brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent5: The clagging of the wet clothes on the line made them dry faster.
